title: 115_s3555
content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to include definitions for LGBT individuals and establishes an Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes an Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration to coordinate improved services for older LGBT individuals. The Office will be headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Office of Older LGBT Policy advocates for older LGBT individuals at the federal and state levels, conducts research on LGBT aging, and collects information on challenges faced by this population. The Office of Older LGBT Policy advocates for older LGBT individuals by collecting and disseminating information on challenges faced, recommending policies, and administering grants to support this population. The Director is required to submit a report to Congress every five years detailing the activities carried out under this subsection. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include a Rural Outreach Grant Program under Part A of title IV. The program aims to provide support to rural communities. The section defines key terms for the Rural Outreach Grant Program, including the Director, eligible entities, and rural areas. The purpose of this section is to provide resources and incentives for connecting with older LGBT individuals in rural areas. The Director may grant funds to eligible entities for approved activities. Applications must be submitted with required information. The Director may require grant applications to include details such as proposed activities, population served, resources available, intent to partner with local organizations, and evidence of eligibility. The Director may require grant applications to include proposed activities, population served, resources available, intent to partner with local organizations, and evidence of eligibility. Approved activities for grants in rural areas aim to create partnerships between older LGBT individuals and eligible entities. Approved activities for grants in rural areas may include education and training for community outreach to older LGBT individuals, reducing isolation, improving access to care, fostering relationships between service providers and older LGBT individuals, and enhancing cultural competency among organizations serving older individuals in rural areas. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant under this section, allowing eligible entities to adapt them as needed. Coordination with local entities is also emphasized. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant under this section, allowing eligible entities to adapt them as needed. Coordination with local entities, including state and local agencies and public/private organizations serving older LGBT individuals, is required for entities receiving grants. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant under this section. Eligible entities must prioritize cooperating with organizations serving economically underserved populations. The Director is required to submit a report to Congress every second fiscal year detailing activities carried out under this section.
